item.title: 关注中国经济和欧佩克+会议，石油走高
item.description: 由于有迹象表明中国经济复苏缓慢，石油价格上涨，交易商期待周四的欧佩克+会议进一步指明方向。【原文：Oil rose on signs of a slow recovery in China’s economy, as traders look to Thursday’s OPEC+ meeting for further direction.】

item.title: 中国奢侈品需求疲软，宝格丽首席执行官寄望印度实现增长
item.description: 路威酩轩集团（LVMH）旗下的珠宝商宝格丽（Bulgari）正将目光投向印度，以缓解中国经济放缓带来的奢侈品需求不振的影响。【原文：LVMH-owned jeweler Bulgari is looking to India to mitigate the effects of faltering luxury demand in China amid an economic slowdown.】

item.title: 美国股市本月表现最佳，亚洲股市有望上涨：市场综述
item.description: 继上周五美股上涨之后，随着全球市场进入季节性强势期，亚洲股市有望谨慎上扬。在美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发出进一步关税威胁后，发展中国家的资产将成为关注焦点。【原文：Asian stocks are poised for cautious gains after US shares rose on Friday and as global markets enter a seasonally strong period. Developing nation assets will be in focus after further tariff threats from US President-elect Donald Trump.】

item.title: 特朗普贸易战的戏剧性与现实性路线图
item.description:
特朗普的关税政策可能会朝着许多不同的方向发展。了解他第一任期的战略及其新团队的优先事项，可以揭示未来的潜在道路。【原文：

Trump’s tariffs could go in many different directions. Understanding the strategy from his first term, and the priorities of his new team, reveals a potential path ahead.

】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 全球对美国玉米的需求正在攀升。世界上最大的电线金属铜供应国的铜产量在多年下降后正在回升。中国电动汽车的蓬勃发展有可能削弱汽油需求。【原文：The world’s appetite for US corn is climbing. Copper output from the world’s top supplier of the wiring metal is clawing back after years of declines. And China’s electric vehicle boom threatens to undermine gasoline demand.】

item.title: 北极星公司将以 50 亿澳元的黄金交易收购德格雷矿业公司
item.description: 北方之星资源有限公司（Northern Star Resources Ltd.）已同意收购德格雷矿业有限公司（De Grey Mining Ltd.），交易价值约为 50 亿澳元（33 亿美元）。【原文：Northern Star Resources Ltd. has agreed to buy De Grey Mining Ltd. in a deal valued at about A$5 billion ($3.3 billion), as gold producers seek to secure more supply amid soaring prices for the precious metal.】

item.title: 中西部的北极寒流和大雪影响节后出行
item.description: 据美国天气预报中心称，未来两天，北极地区的严寒和降雪将在五大湖区造成危险状况，可能会打乱数百万人的出行计划。【原文：An arctic blast of severe cold and snow is creating hazardous conditions across the Great Lakes region over the next two days, according to the US Weather Prediction Center, potentially disrupting the plans of millions traveling the roads and skies.】

item.title: 挪威内阁盟友阻止深海采矿许可证发放至2026年
item.description: 作为议会通过预算协议的一部分，挪威政府开放海底采矿的计划已被搁置。【原文：The Norwegian government’s plans to open up for mining on the sea floor have been shelved as part of a deal to get its budget through parliament.】

item.title: 贝莱德即将达成收购私人信贷管理公司 HPS 的交易
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. ）正接近达成收购 HPS Investment Partners 的交易，此次收购将使该公司跻身私人信贷的顶级行列，从而成为另类资产领域的一支重要力量。【原文：BlackRock Inc. is nearing a deal to buy HPS Investment Partners, a purchase that would vault the firm into the top ranks of private credit as it seeks to become a major force in alternative assets.】

item.title: 加拿大边境部长称特朗普会晤后即将采取新措施
item.description: 加拿大总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）的一位高级官员表示，加拿大政府将以 "明显而有力的方式 "加强边境执法，以避免唐纳德-特朗普的新政府征收关税。【原文：Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government will step up border enforcement in a “visible and muscular way,” according to a top Canadian official, as the nation tries to avoid tariffs from Donald Trump’s new administration.】

item.title: 斯泰兰特首席执行官塔瓦雷斯将从菲亚特制造商吉普离职
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，吉普 SUV 和菲亚特汽车制造商 Stellantis NV 首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯（Carlos Tavares）将在利润下滑和美国销售疲软后下台。【原文：Stellantis NV Chief Executive Officer Carlos Tavares is stepping down after profit slumped and US sales weakened at the maker of Jeep SUVs and Fiat cars, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 路透社称孟加拉国希望重新谈判阿达尼电力协议
item.description: 路透社援引孟加拉国电力部负责人的话报道称，如果法院不取消与阿达尼集团的购电协议，孟加拉国希望与阿达尼集团重新谈判。【原文：Bangladesh wants to renegotiate its power purchase deal with Adani Group if the agreement isn’t canceled by a court, Reuters reported, citing the head of its power ministry.】

item.title: 凯茜-伍德欢迎特朗普回归所预示的宽松监管
item.description: 方舟投资管理有限责任公司的凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）表示，她欢迎唐纳德-特朗普就任总统后，监管有望进入宽松时代，尤其是在技术、加密货币和数字资产方面。【原文：Ark Investment Management LLC’s Cathie Wood said she welcomes an expected era of looser regulation once Donald Trump is inaugurated as president, notably on technology, cryptocurrencies and digital assets.】

item.title: 秘鲁通货膨胀率连续八个月保持在目标范围内
item.description: 周日公布的数据显示，秘鲁首都 11 月份的通货膨胀率连续第八个月保持在中央银行的目标范围内。【原文：Inflation in Peru’s capital stayed within the central bank’s target band in November for the eighth straight month, according to data published Sunday.】

item.title: 马斯克敦促法院阻止 OpenAI 的 "非法 "营利性转换
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）要求联邦法院阻止OpenAI "非法 "转为营利性企业，并表示急需暂停该 ChatGPT 制造商不断加速的主导地位，以保护他自己的人工智能初创公司和公众。【原文：Elon Musk asked a federal court to block OpenAI from pursuing an “illegal” conversion to a for-profit business, saying that a pause on the ChatGPT maker’s accelerating dominance is urgently needed to protect his own artificial intelligence startup as well as the public.】

item.title: 机构接管比特币带来新的风险清单
item.description: 比特币交易所交易基金在美国取得了巨大成功，目前已持有超过 100 万枚比特币代币，约占现有总量的 5%。这与比特币市场的 "始祖鲸鱼 "钱包中长期冻结的比特币数量相当：加密货币的匿名和神秘创造者中本聪（Satoshi Nakamoto）。【原文：Bitcoin exchange-traded funds have been such a smashing success in the US that they now hold more than 1 million of the tokens, or about 5% of what currently exists. That’s in the same ballpark as the amounts that have long been frozen in the wallet of the market’s original whale: The cryptocurrency’s anonymous and enigmatic creator known as Satoshi Nakamoto.】

item.title: 特朗普回归，新兴市场投资者面临股票与债券的两难选择
item.description: 投资者正争先恐后地决定，唐纳德-特朗普即将重返白宫是会维持还是破坏乔-拜登领导下的新兴市场债券反弹。【原文：Investors are scrambling to decide if Donald Trump’s impending return to the White House will sustain or derail the rally in emerging-market bonds witnessed under Joe Biden.】

item.title: 澳大利亚房价增速为近两年来最弱
item.description: 澳大利亚房价的涨幅是近两年来最弱的，主要市场悉尼和墨尔本的房价下跌带动了房价的上涨，因为人们对房价承受能力的担忧日益加剧，影响了购房者的需求。【原文：Australian home prices rose at their weakest pace in nearly two years, led by falling prices in the key markets of Sydney and Melbourne as mounting affordability concerns sour buyer demand.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯的美国国债持有量创 2020 年以来新高
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯持有的美国国债占其中央银行持有的外国资产的比例在 10 月份上升到四年来的最高水平。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s holdings of US Treasuries as a portion of foreign assets held by its central bank rose in October to the most in four years.】

item.title: 大众汽车工会将于周一就削减成本计划举行罢工
item.description: 德国大众汽车公司（Volkswagen AG）的工人计划从周一开始举行罢工，因为工会领导人和管理层未能就如何削减该汽车制造商同名品牌的成本达成协议。【原文：Volkswagen AG workers across Germany plan to stage walkouts starting Monday after labor leaders and management failed to reach an agreement over how to slash costs at the carmaker’s namesake brand.】

item.title: Holcim 向华新水泥出售尼日利亚业务，价值 10 亿美元
item.description: 瑞士建材公司 Holcim AG 同意将其尼日利亚业务出售给中国华新水泥股份有限公司，交易价值为 10 亿美元。【原文：Swiss building materials company Holcim AG agreed to sell its Nigerian business to China’s Huaxin Cement Co. in a deal that values the asset at $1 billion.】

item.title: 足球明星里奥-费迪南德入股沙特体育应用程序
item.description: 英国足球明星里奥-费迪南德（Rio Ferdinand）的费迪南德集团（The Ferdinand Group）正在投资沙特阿拉伯的体育平台 Koora Break，以帮助其在欧洲和亚洲拓展业务。【原文：UK football star Rio Ferdinand’s The Ferdinand Group is investing in Saudi Arabia-based sports platform Koora Break to help it expand across Europe and Asia.】

item.title: 英国就业统计危机令银行日益头疼
item.description: 由于英国错误的劳动力市场数据引起的混乱，英国的银行可能会拨出额外的资金来弥补不良贷款。【原文：Britain’s banks may be putting extra money aside to cover bad loans due to confusion around the country’s faulty labor market data.】

item.title: 在应对特朗普之前，欧盟新领导人旨在结束布鲁塞尔的争吵
item.description:
葡萄牙前总理安东尼奥-科斯塔（Antonio Costa）在欧盟面临来自各方的威胁和挑战之际，成为欧盟领导人理事会第四任主席

。【原文：

Former Portuguese Prime Minister Antonio Costa becomes the fourth president of the EU leaders’ council at a moment when the bloc faces threats and challenges from all sides

】

item.title: 沙特化妆品零售商 Nice One 宣布首次公开募股 3.2 亿美元
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯在线化妆品零售商 Nice One Beauty 计划在利雅得首次公开发行股票，筹集多达 12.1 亿里亚尔（约合 3.22 亿美元）的资金，这将为沙特阿拉伯王国今年的上市热潮再添一笔。【原文：Saudi Arabian online cosmetics retailer Nice One Beauty plans to raise as much as 1.21 billion riyals ($322 million) with an initial public offering in Riyadh, adding to a flurry of listings in the kingdom this year.】

item.title: 意大利努力收获欧盟复苏基金的果实
item.description: 现在是罗马周边山区的橄榄收获季节，一家拥有百年历史的家族企业正在对机器进行升级改造，这既展示了意大利在欧盟资金投入方面的成果，也暴露了其不足之处。【原文：It’s olive season in the hills around Rome, where a century-old family business upgrading its machinery showcases both the fruits and shortcomings of Italy’s efforts to spend European Union cash.】

item.title: 澳门 11 月博彩收入增长 14.9%，超出预期
item.description: 澳门 11 月份的博彩收入增长了 14.9%，超出了分析师的预期。【原文：Macau’s gaming revenue rose 14.9% in November, exceeding analysts’ expectations in a month that’s typically slow due to a lack of holidays.】

item.title: 百度获得香港首张自动驾驶汽车测试牌照
item.description: 中国科技巨头百度公司（Baidu Inc.【原文：Chinese tech giant Baidu Inc. has won Hong Kong’s first license to test autonomous vehicles in the city as the company seeks to expand its driverless technology beyond mainland China.】

item.title: 香港财政司司长预计到 2035 年机场容量将增加 50
item.description: 财政司司长陈茂波在每周博客中表示，到 2035 年，香港国际机场的吞吐量将增加 50%。【原文：Hong Kong International Airport’s handling capacity will increase 50% by 2035, Financial Secretary Paul Chan said in his weekly blog.】

item.title: 中国首次从商业发射场发射火箭
item.description: 周六晚，中国从一个新的商业航天基地发射了第一枚火箭，中国正试图在目前由埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）主导的业务领域扩大自己的影响力。【原文：China launched its first rocket from a new commercial space site on Saturday night as the country attempts to expand its presence in a business currently led by Elon Musk’s SpaceX.】
